file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 38-32-06-04 - CONFIG-2 - TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the toilet drain cable. B. The toilet drain cable goes through a conduit and is attached to the toilet unit and to the waste service panel with nuts. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-06-000-802-A TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL EMB-135 ACFT MODEL(S) 38-32-06-400-802-A TOILET DRAIN CABLE - INSTALLATION EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-06-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. TOILET DRAIN CABLE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for removal of the toilet drain cable. (2) To get access to the toilet drain cable, you must remove: the toilet shroud assembly, the baggage-compartment floor lining, and baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF. You also must open the waste-service panel door. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - RE- AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400 MOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor 193 193MR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor 1 Helps with the task In the lavatory and outside the aircraft I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-013-A (1) Remove the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-000-801-A/400). (3) Remove baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (4) Open waste-service panel door 193MR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-013-A (1) Remove the nuts (1) that attach the upper part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the support. Refer to DET. B. (2) Loosen the toilet-drain cable nut (2). Refer to DET. C. (3) Get access through the baggage compartment floor and remove the sealant (6) from the nut (4) and washer (5). Refer to DET. C and DET. D. (4) Remove the nut (4) and washer (5) that attach the lower part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the waste service panel. Refer to DET. C. (5) Remove and discard the tie-down strap (7) to release the toilet drain cable (3) from the hose assembly (Ref.). Refer to DET. E. (6) Through the waste service panel, remove the toilet drain cable (3) together with its conduit. Refer to DET. F. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 Toilet Drain Cable - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 162 F E ZONE 193 1. NUT C DET. B 7. TIE-DOWN DET. A STRAP 2. BOLT DET. G 1 APPLY LOCTITE 221 EM145AMM380020E.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 38-32-06-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. TOILET DRAIN CABLE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure for installation of the toilet drain cable. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400 TOILET SHROUD ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION BAGGAGE-COMPARTMENT FLOOR LINING - IN- AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400 STALLATION SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272AF Baggage compartment floor 193 193MR Rear wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-S-8802, TYPE II, CLASS B2 Sealant, PR 1440 B2 AR MS3367-1-9 Tiedown strap 2 LOCTITE 221 (MEP 09-005) Anaerobic Adhesive - Type I Loctite 221 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Under the baggage compartment floor 1 Helps with the task In the lavatory and outside the aircraft EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-013-A (1) Through the waste service panel, put the toilet drain cable (3) in position together with its conduit. Refer to DET. F. (2) Get access through the baggage compartment floor and install the nut (4) and the washer (5) that attach the lower part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the waste service panel. Refer to DET. C. (3) Apply sealant (6) to the nut (4) and washer (5) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. D. (4) Connect the toilet drain cable nut (2). Refer to DET. B. (5) Install the nuts (1) that attach the upper part of the toilet drain cable (3) to the support. Refer to DET. B. (6) Install the toilet drain cable (3) to the hose assembly (Ref.) and attach it with a new tie- down strap (7). Refer to DET. E. (7) Make sure that the bolt (10) that attaches the handle (8) is tight. (8) If you think that the bolt (10) will possibly come loose on the handle (8), do the steps that follow: 1. Remove the bolt (10) and washer (9) from the handle (8) and apply a thin layer of the Loctite 221 adhesive to their threads. 2. Install the washer (9) and the bolt (10). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-013-A (1) Close waste-service panel door 193MR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Install baggage-compartment floor panel 272AF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Install the baggage-compartment floor lining ( AMM TASK 25-51-04-400-801-A/400). (4) Install the toilet shroud assembly ( AMM TASK 25-40-04-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 38-32-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
